issue.title: fix(oracle): clean oracle constraints
issue.body:
## Pull Request Checklist

- [ ] Have you added new tests to prevent regressions?
- [ ] If a documentation update is necessary, have you opened a PR to [the documentation repository](https://github.com/sequelize/website/)? <!-- Put PR link here -->
- [ ] Did you update the typescript typings accordingly (if applicable)?
- [X] Does the description below contain a link to an existing issue (Closes #[issue]) or a description of the issue you are solving?
- [X] Does the name of your PR follow [our conventions](https://github.com/sequelize/sequelize/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#6-commit-your-modifications)?

## Description Of Change

Oracle doesn't support "ON UPDATE" actions in constraints and it throws an error if defined. It also doesn't support "ON DELETE NO ACTION".

The PR modifies `addConstraintQuery` method to avoid errors.

comment.body:
@cbardasano can you add an unit test in [this file](https://github.com/sequelize/sequelize/blob/v6/test/unit/sql/add-constraint.test.js) that fails on current v6 but passes now with this change?

@sudarshan12s @hjamil-24 can you review this as well?

issue.title: DB "memory leaks" during inserts by "CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION"

labels.name: pending-approval
labels.description: Bug reports that have not been verified yet, or feature requests that have not been accepted yet

issue.body:
The issue is related to insertQuery function with options.exception=True on high load systems.
https://github.com/sequelize/sequelize/blob/95d3a5713499ab90b19d7a312b8cb878b26eb1b4/lib/dialects/abstract/query-generator.js#L154

PostgeSQL does not release session memory after "CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION" and in a case of high intensive usage of such queries in one session, the DB session process consumes more and more memory.
From the system point of view it looks like memory leaks of DB.  
An example below consumes 500MB DB memory for 18K executions.
I am not sure that it can/will be fixed by Sequelize or PostgreSQL because it is a definitely wrong pattern to use "CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION" to insert high amount of data. 
Anyway, I would open this issue to everybody who spends days to find a reason why DB has "memory leaks".
The same problem was discussed in PostgreSQL bug tacker 7 year ago:
https://www.postgresql.org/message-id/flat/20161028162317.15991.74004%40wrigleys.postgresql.org

The issue is reproducible on PostgreSQL 11 and 12 but was not tested on other versions.

The following script reproduces the problem:
```
import psycopg2
import sys

def create_or_replace (n, cur, conn):
  print ("Doing action " + str(n)) 
  query=(f"CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION pg_temp.testfunc(OUT response test, OUT sequelize_caught_exception text) \
            RETURNS RECORD AS $func_a8%s$ BEGIN INSERT INTO test2 (\"id\") VALUES (%s) RETURNING * INTO response; \
      EXCEPTION WHEN unique_violation THEN GET STACKED DIAGNOSTICS sequelize_caught_exception = PG_EXCEPTION_DETAIL; \
      END $func_a8%s$ LANGUAGE plpgsql; \
      SELECT (testfunc.response).*, testfunc.sequelize_caught_exception FROM pg_temp.testfunc(); \
      DROP FUNCTION IF EXISTS pg_temp.testfunc();"%(str(n),str(n),str(n)))
  cur.execute(query)
  conn.commit()

def lots_of_create_or_replace(t, cur, conn) :
  print ("Doing lots of actions for t" + str(t)) 
  for n in range(1, 100000000):
    create_or_replace(n+t, cur, conn)
  print("Finished")

conn = psycopg2.connect(
    database="postgres",
    user="XXXXXXXXXXX",
    password="XXXXXXXXXXXXXX",
    host="XXXXXXXXXXX.rds.amazonaws.com",
    port='5432'
)

cur = conn.cursor()
cur.execute("DELETE FROM test2;")
lots_of_create_or_replace(int(sys.argv[1]), cur,conn)
```

issue.title: Make afterSync hook know if new table was created or not

labels.name: type: feature
labels.description: For issues and PRs. For new features. Never breaking changes.

labels.name: pending-approval
labels.description: Bug reports that have not been verified yet, or feature requests that have not been accepted yet

issue.body:
At present time there is no way to know if table was actually created after completing particlurar sync operation (while I observe that query CREATE TABLE does not executed for already created table, despite of being used with IF NOT EXISTS directive).
So object passed to afterSync function, could be extended with boolean property **isTableCreated**.
Trying on sequelize 6.32.1 and postgres 13.4

issue.title: attr[0].includes is not a function

labels.name: pending-approval
labels.description: Bug reports that have not been verified yet, or feature requests that have not been accepted yet

issue.body:
<!--
If you don't follow the issue template, your issue may be closed.

Remember to properly format your code in code blocks.

Please note this is an issue tracker, not a support forum.
For general questions, please use one of these:
- StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/sequelize.js
- GitHub discussions: https://github.com/sequelize/sequelize/discussions
-->

## Issue Creation Checklist

- [x] I understand that my issue will be automatically closed if I don't fill in the requested information
- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/sequelize/sequelize/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

## Bug Description

When using `fn`, `cast`, `col` on `attributes` for select queries, i get errors. Current version of sequelize installed: `"sequelize": "^6.28.0"`

### Reproducible Example

1. for a select query, add sequelize functions for the attributes like AVG or COUNT


Here is my code:

```typescript
import * as Sequelize from 'Sequelize';

let sequelize = new Sequelize.Sequelize(<string> process.env.DATABASE_URL, {
      dialect: 'postgres',
      dialectOptions: {
        ssl: false,
        rejectUnauthorized: false
      },
      logging: false
    });

export const common_model_options: Sequelize.InitOptions = {
  sequelize: sequelizeInst,

  paranoid: true,
  timestamps: true,
  freezeTableName: true,
  underscored: true,
  createdAt: 'created_at',
  updatedAt: 'updated_at',
  deletedAt: 'deleted_at',
};

export const common_model_fields = {
  id:           { type: Sequelize.INTEGER, primaryKey: true, autoIncrement: true },
  uuid:         { type: Sequelize.STRING, defaultValue: uuidv1 }
};

export const Notice = <MyModelStatic> sequelize.define('Notice', {
  ...common_model_fields,

  owner_id:            { type: Sequelize.INTEGER, allowNull: false, references: { model: User, key: 'id' } },

  parent_notice_id:    { type: Sequelize.INTEGER, allowNull: true, references: { model: 'Notice', key: 'id' } }, // if this notice is a reply to another
  quoting_notice_id:   { type: Sequelize.INTEGER, allowNull: true, references: { model: 'Notice', key: 'id' } }, // if this notice is quoting another
  share_notice_id:     { type: Sequelize.INTEGER, allowNull: true, references: { model: 'Notice', key: 'id' } }, // if this notice is a share of another

  body:                { type: Sequelize.STRING(500), allowNull: true },
  tags:                { type: Sequelize.STRING, allowNull: false, defaultValue: '' },

  is_explicit:         { type: Sequelize.BOOLEAN, allowNull: false, defaultValue: false },
  is_private:          { type: Sequelize.BOOLEAN, allowNull: false, defaultValue: false },
  visibility:          { type: Sequelize.STRING(75), allowNull: false, defaultValue: '' },
}, { ...common_model_options, tableName: `Notice`, modelName: `Notice` });

Notice.hasMany(Notice, { as: 'notice_replies', foreignKey: 'parent_notice_id', sourceKey: 'id' });
Notice.belongsTo(Notice, { as: 'parent_notice', foreignKey: 'parent_notice_id', targetKey: 'id' });
Notice.hasMany(Notice, { as: 'notice_quotes', foreignKey: 'quoting_notice_id', sourceKey: 'id' });
Notice.belongsTo(Notice, { as: 'quote_notice', foreignKey: 'quoting_notice_id', targetKey: 'id' });
Notice.hasMany(Notice, { as: 'notice_shares', foreignKey: 'share_notice_id', sourceKey: 'id' });
Notice.belongsTo(Notice, { as: 'share_notice', foreignKey: 'share_notice_id', targetKey: 'id' });

// now the failing part:

const noticeStats = await Notice.findOne({
    where: { id: 1 },
    attributes: {
      include: [
        [fn('COUNT', col('Notice.parent_notice_id')), 'replies_count'] // this causes the bug
      ]
    },
    group: ['Notice.parent_notice_id'],
  });

```


### What do you expect to happen?

The returned model/data has the additional attributes specified in the query

### What is actually happening?

a bug:

```
/Users/ryanwaite/Developer/avenger-server-express/node_modules/Sequelize/lib/dialects/abstract/query-generator.js:1048
        } else if (!attr[0].includes("(") && !attr[0].includes(")")) {
                            ^

TypeError: attr[0].includes is not a function
    at /Users/ryanwaite/Developer/avenger-server-express/node_modules/Sequelize/lib/dialects/abstract/query-generator.js:1048:29
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at PostgresQueryGenerator.escapeAttributes (/Users/ryanwaite/Developer/avenger-server-express/node_modules/Sequelize/lib/dialects/abstract/query-generator.js:1035:37)
    at PostgresQueryGenerator.selectQuery (/Users/ryanwaite/Developer/avenger-server-express/node_modules/Sequelize/lib/dialects/abstract/query-generator.js:843:28)
    at PostgresQueryInterface.select (/Users/ryanwaite/Developer/avenger-server-express/node_modules/Sequelize/lib/dialects/abstract/query-interface.js:407:59)
    at Function.findAll (/Users/ryanwaite/Developer/avenger-server-express/node_modules/Sequelize/lib/model.js:1134:47)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:96:5)
    at async Function.findOne (/Users/ryanwaite/Developer/avenger-server-express/node_modules/Sequelize/lib/model.js:1228:12)
    at async test (/Users/ryanwaite/Developer/avenger-server-express/dist/scripts/test-notice-manager.script.js:86:25)

```

### Environment

Local

```
"dependencies": {
    "@aws-sdk/client-s3": "^3.32.0",
    "@aws-sdk/client-ses": "^3.224.0",
    "@aws-sdk/node-http-handler": "^3.32.0",
    "@googlemaps/google-maps-services-js": "^3.1.16",
    "@overnightjs/core": "^1.6.9",
    "@overnightjs/jwt": "^1.1.14",
    "@overnightjs/logger": "^1.1.9",
    "@sendgrid/mail": "^6.5.4",
    "@types/bcrypt-nodejs": "0.0.31",
    "@types/bluebird": "^3.5.28",
    "@types/client-sessions": "^0.8.0",
    "@types/cookie-parser": "^1.4.2",
    "@types/cors": "^2.8.6",
    "@types/express": "^4.17.14",
    "@types/express-fileupload": "^1.1.0",
    "@types/jsonwebtoken": "^8.5.0",
    "@types/node": "^18.11.11",
    "@types/node-mailjet": "^3.3.3",
    "@types/nunjucks": "^3.1.3",
    "@types/socket.io": "^2.1.3",
    "@types/uuid": "^8.3.1",
    "@types/validator": "^10.11.3",
    "autoprefixer": "^9.6.1",
    "aws-sdk": "^2.1013.0",
    "axios": "^0.21.4",
    "bcrypt": "^3.0.6",
    "bcrypt-nodejs": "0.0.3",
    "body-parser": "^1.19.0",
    "class-transformer": "^0.5.1",
    "class-transformer-validator": "^0.9.1",
    "class-validator": "^0.14.0",
    "clean-webpack-plugin": "^3.0.0",
    "client-sessions": "^0.8.0",
    "cloudinary": "^1.20.0",
    "cookie-parser": "^1.4.5",
    "cors": "^2.8.5",
    "css-loader": "^3.2.0",
    "dotenv": "^16.0.3",
    "expo-server-sdk": "^3.6.0",
    "express": "^4.18.2",
    "express-device": "^0.4.2",
    "express-fileupload": "^1.1.6-alpha.5",
    "express-validator": "^6.14.2",
    "fs": "0.0.1-security",
    "html-loader": "^0.5.5",
    "html-webpack-plugin": "^3.2.0",
    "http-status-codes": "^1.3.2",
    "jsonwebtoken": "^8.5.1",
    "moment": "^2.29.4",
    "moment-precise-range-plugin": "^1.3.0",
    "moment-range": "^4.0.2",
    "moment-strftime": "^0.5.0",
    "multer": "^1.4.5-lts.1",
    "net": "^1.0.2",
    "nexmo": "^2.7.0",
    "ngrok": "^4.3.3",
    "node-mailjet": "^3.3.1",
    "nodemon": "^2.0.20",
    "nunjucks": "^3.2.0",
    "peer": "^0.6.1",
    "pg": "^8.8.0",
    "pg-hstore": "^2.3.4",
    "postcss-loader": "^3.0.0",
    "reflect-metadata": "^0.1.13",
    "sequelize": "^6.28.0",
    "socket.io": "^4.5.1",
    "stripe": "^11.2.0",
    "ts-loader": "^6.2.0",
    "tslib": "^2.0.1",
    "tslint": "^5.20.0",
    "typeorm": "^0.2.24",
    "typescript": "^4.9.3",
    "unirest": "^0.6.0",
    "uuid": "^8.3.2",
    "uws": "^100.0.1",
    "validator": "^13.7.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "parcel-bundler": "^1.12.4",
    "ts-node": "^10.9.1",
    "webpack": "^4.41.2",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.3.9"
  }
```

node: 16.17.0
npm: 8.15.0

## Would you be willing to resolve this issue by submitting a Pull Request?

<!-- Remember that first contributors are welcome! -->

- [ ] Yes, I have the time and I know how to start.
- [x] Yes, I have the time but I will need guidance.
- [ ] No, I don't have the time, but my company or I are [supporting Sequelize through donations on OpenCollective](https://opencollective.com/sequelize).
- [ ] No, I don't have the time, and I understand that I will need to wait until someone from the community or maintainers is interested in resolving my issue.

---
